business.headline: Sugar sector urges government to push ethanol blending beyond 20%: ReportEthanol producers have collectively offered 17,760 million litres for the ethanol supply year 2025–26 (ESY), which far exceeds the oil marketing companies' (OMCs) annual requirement of around 10,500 million litres.

Expecting your entire CTC as salary? Here's the reality checkMany first-time earners walk into their jobs assuming the number on their offer letter will land in their bank account. But when the first payslip arrives, reality hits hard. The gap between CTC and take-home pay is bigger than most realise.

Gold nears Rs 1.3 lakh. Is it wise to buy before Dhanteras?As gold inches close to Rs 1.3 lakh per 10 grams, festive shoppers are facing a dilemma. With Dhanteras around the corner, the big question is simple: buy now or hold off in hope of a dip?

Sensex jumps 500 points: What's driving today's stock market rallyBy mid-morning, the S&P BSE Sensex had gained 474.63 points to 82,504.61, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 161.90 points to 25,309.65. Most other indices across sectors also saw healthy gains, reflecting broad-based buying.

Is Goldman Sachs planning to cut jobs? Check hereGoldman Sachs is gearing up for another round of layoffs as it speeds up its shift towards artificial intelligence under its OneGS 3.0 strategy, mention reports.

Diwali Picks 2025: How can you build your portfolio this festive season As markets steady ahead of Diwali, analysts say the current calm could be the base for the next rally — a chance to quietly build wealth before the noise returns.

Q2 earnings lift IT stocks, but should investors join the rally?Experts suggest that while the IT sector looks promising in the short term, investors should take a cautious approach and focus on selective stocks that show consistent growth potential.
Sensex opens over 200 points higher, Nifty above 25,200; NTPC up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 322.86 points to 82,352.84, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 105.50 points to 25,250.55 as oif 9:35 am.

LG Electronics IPO rocks NSE, and so does LG's Korean MD with his speechLG Electronics India's Korean Managing Director, Hong Ju Jeon, won hearts across India when he addressed the audience entirely in Hindi at the company's listing ceremony.

EPFO eases withdrawal rules, but there is a catch. Details HereThe EPFO has made a big change by allowing members to withdraw their entire provident fund balance. Still, the revised rules include a major catch that not everyone may find favourable.

No proof Sunjay Kapur drafted will: Karisma Kapoor's kids call Priya acute gamblerIn the ongoing Sunjay Kapur property dispute, senior advocate Mahesh Jethmalani, representing actor Karisma Kapoor's children, slammed the late industralist's widow, Priya Kapur, calling her an "acute gambler" and saying there was no proof whether Sunjay Kapur had actually drafted the will.

Diwali 2025: Expert lists best sectors to light up your long-term portfolioOnce seen as a risky bet for the daring few, it's now finding a place right beside traditional investments. From young professionals buying their first mutual fund to families creating demat accounts, the shift is real and growing.

Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; LG Electronics listing lights up D-StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 297.07 points to close at 82,029.98, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 81.85 points to settle at 25,145.50.

India proving doubters wrong with its economic reforms: IMF chiefSpeaking ahead of the IMF-World Bank annual meetings in Washington, Georgieva said India's strong economic policies and reforms have helped it stand out as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Forget stocks, why should you track gold and silver rally this DiwaliWith markets showing uncertainty, should investors consider precious metals over stocks this festive season? Experts explain.
LG Electronics IPO sees bumper listing. Why you shouldn't sell entire stake todayLG Electronics IPO surged over 50% on listing, but should investors sell everything today or hold for bigger gains?

Digital finance isn't foolproof, cautions Zerodha's Nithin KamathFrom Aadhaar e-Sign to mobile apps, digital finance has transformed access to financial services in India. However, Nithin Kamath points out that system failures and delays still pose challenges for users.

Bira 91 went poof! And the name change was just the beer headWhile several news reports said that a change in the name of Indian beer Bira 91 spelt doom for the craft beer brand, it was just the tip of the iceberg. The company is facing a Rs 80-crore loss, supply-chain disruption, and most importantly, internal unrest, with employees demanding the ouster of founder Ankur Jain. This is what industry insiders have to say about the mess at Bira 91.

EPFO now allows 100% PF withdrawal. 7 major changes you should knowMembers of EPFO can now breathe a sigh of relief as the organisation allows full withdrawal of PF balances. Here's a look at seven important changes that will affect how you access your funds.

LG Electronics IPO makes bumper debut. Should you hold or sell?With the stock listing at a sharp premium, booking partial profits allows investors to secure immediate gains, while retaining a portion of shares could help benefit from the company's long-term growth trajectory.

entertainment.headline: Annamalai praises Dhanush's Idli Kadai: Like Rishab, you excel as director, actor BJP's Annamalai sent a letter appreciating actor Dhanush's directorial 'Idli Kadai'.  He highlighted the film's portrayal of youth issues and village culture.

Ali Fazal celebrates birthday in Benares, shares selfie with Mirzapur cast Actor Ali Fazal celebrated his birthday in Benaras with the rest of the cast of the 'Mirzapur' film. He gave fans a glimpse into his birthday celebrations on social media. However, it was a selfie with the entire cast that caught the attention of fans.

K-drama Delusion halts China shoot amid Jun Ji Hyun's Tempest backlash 'Delusion' cancels overseas shoot in China for upcoming drama starring Suzy and Kim Seon Ho. Sudden change follows backlash over Jun Ji Hyun's Tempest dialogue in China

Sunjay Kapur's wife Priya shares tribute on his birth anniversary, talks legacy Priya Sachdev Kapur penned a heartfelt tribute to her late husband, Sunjay Kapur, on his 54th birth anniversary, recalling his legacy as a devoted family man. Sharing a touching video and verses from the Bhagavad Gita, Priya remembered Sunjay's kindness, strength, and enduring love, saying, "Some souls don't depart; they expand."

Bombay High Court to protect Akshay Kumar against misuse of deepfake videos Bombay High Court is set to grant interim protection to actor Akshay Kumar against misuse of deepfake videos. The court highlights the serious consequences of AI-generated impersonations on public perception and the actor's reputation.

Diljit Dosanjh to appear on Amitabh Bachchan's KBC 17 to aid Punjab flood victims Diljit Dosanjh will participate in a special episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', hosted by Amitabh Bachchan, with his winnings to be donated to Punjab flood victims.

Ilaiyaraaja's T Nagar studio gets bomb threat, search conducted A bomb threat email was sent to Ilaiyaraaja's studio in T Nagar. The Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad conducted a search at his studio and confirmed it as a hoax.

Actor Pankaj Dheer, the iconic Karn of Mahabharat, dies after cancer battle Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, best known for playing Karna in BR Chopra's iconic 'Mahabharat', died on October 15. The actor had reportedly been battling cancer, which relapsed a few months ago despite undergoing major surgery.

Britney Spears, Kevin Federline clash again as memoir and posts spark drama Kevin Federline's upcoming memoir contains allegations about Britney Spears' behaviour. Britney Spears and her representative respond to claims and media attention.

Abhinav Kashyap questions Salman Khan playing a war hero in Battle of Galwan Director Abhinav Kashyap reignited his feud with Salman Khan over the actor's role in 'Battle of Galwan'. The clash reflects on the deep personal and professional rifts within the entertainment industry.

Pakistan's youth swipe right and conservatives lose sleep over Lazawal Ishq 'Lazawal Ishq', Pakistan's first online dating show, has sparked a culture clash, pitting a modern, digital generation against old-school morality.

Ahead of baby's arrival, Alia Bhatt sends gifts to mother-to-be Parineeti Chopra Actor Alia Bhatt sent a special hamper to her colleague Parineeti Chopra, who is expecting her first child. Parineeti expressed gratitude and excitement on social media.

Breaking the beat: When dancers get the Bollywood act right They started with rhythm in their veins, not scripts in their hands. Today, they're proving that the dance floor can be a gateway to stardom. The story explores how stars like Raghav Juyal, Nora Fatehi, and others have emerged as global icons.

Priyamani on reuniting for The Family Man 3, working with Manoj Bajpayee and SRK In an exclusive conversation with India Today, actor Priyamani shared her excitement about returning for 'The Family Man' Season 3. She highlighted the strong chemistry with Manoj Bajpayee and unique experiences working with Shah Rukh Khan.

Prasoon Joshi receives MP govt's National Kishore Kumar Award, expresses gratitude Lyricist Prasoon Joshi expressed gratitude after being honoured with Madhya Pradesh government's National Kishore Kumar Award.

Shweta Tripathi performs Ganga aarti amid Mirzapur: The Movie shoot in Benaras Actress Shweta Tripathi performed Ganga aarti at a Benaras ghat while shooting for Mirzapur: The Movie. The emotional moment underscores her longstanding personal and professional ties with the city.

Smriti Irani reacts to Kyunki 2 being pitted against Rupali Ganguly's Anupamaa Smriti Irani breaks her silence on the 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' vs 'Anupamaa' TRP race, saying her iconic show's legacy is beyond competition. Reflecting on 25 years of the show and its unmatched success, the actor-turned-politician praises Ekta Kapoor for creating a legend.

Send Help trailer: Rachel McAdams, Dylan O'Brien in Sam Raimi's horror comedy The trailer for 'Send Help' shows Rachel McAdams and Dylan O'Brien stranded after a plane crash. The film promises to mix dark comedy with survival drama, and highlight a tense power struggle on a deserted island.

Kantara 2 box office Day 13: Rishab Shetty's film roars on, Rs 500 crore in sight Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' continues its unstoppable box office streak, collecting Rs 465.25 crore nett in 13 days and crossing Rs 100 crore overseas. The mythological action epic is eyeing the Rs 500 crore milestone domestically and Rs 650 crore worldwide.

general news.headline: Sex abuse, gangsters, bribes: Twin cop suicides expose rot in Haryana PoliceHaryana Cop Suicide: The saga, which started with the suicide of senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, took a new twist this week after an assistant sub-inspector (ASI) allegedly shot himself and blamed the former of corruption.
JDU names 57 candidates in 1st Bihar list, snipes seats eyed by Chirag PaswanNitish Kumar's JDU has released first candidate list, with 57 names, for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

Actor Pankaj Dheer, the iconic Karn of Mahabharat, dies after cancer battleVeteran actor Pankaj Dheer, best known for playing Karna in BR Chopra's iconic 'Mahabharat', died on October 15. The actor had reportedly been battling cancer, which relapsed a few months ago despite undergoing major surgery.

Why Ashley Tellis arrest by FBI has sparked political war in IndiaThe arrest of Indian-American geopolitical strategist Ashley Tellis has ignited a fierce political battle in India. He is charged with unlawfully retaining classified US defence documents and meeting with Chinese officials. The BJP alleged that he was part of the "anti-India" force and "celebrated by the Opposition".
Pakistan's Lal Masjid momentWill the crackdown on the Tehreek-e-Labbaik spark off a new wave of violence?

Ashley Tellis: From helping broker civil nuclear deal to rabid India detractorThe arrest of US foreign policy expert Ashley Tellis marks a stunning fall for a man once hailed as one of the key architects of the India-US nuclear deal. In recent years, Tellis has been one of the sharpest critics of the Narendra Modi-led government.

Tamil Nadu to table bill seeking ban on Hindi hoardings, movies, songs: SourcesTamil Nadu plans to table a bill today banning Hindi hoardings, boards, movies, and songs, said sources. Officials stressed the move will comply with the Constitution. BJP called it absurd and a political diversion.

'Give Shehbaz Sharif a Nobel for bootlicking': Pak PM roasted for Trump flatteryAt the Gaza Summit in Egypt, Shehbaz Sharif may have impressed Trump with his effusive praise, but the Pakistan PM also earned a flood of online mockery and the 'bootlicker' tag.

Sunjay Kapur's wife Priya shares tribute on his birth anniversary, talks legacyPriya Sachdev Kapur penned a heartfelt tribute to her late husband, Sunjay Kapur, on his 54th birth anniversary, recalling his legacy as a devoted family man. Sharing a touching video and verses from the Bhagavad Gita, Priya remembered Sunjay's kindness, strength, and enduring love, saying, "Some souls don't depart; they expand."

Amazon plans major layoffs, up to 15% of HR staff and more could be firedAmazon is preparing to cut up to 15 per cent of staff in its HR division as part of a broader AI-driven restructuring. While the exact number of jobs affected is unknown, the Fortune report says other departments are also in the radar.

Pakistan's youth swipe right and conservatives lose sleep over Lazawal Ishq'Lazawal Ishq', Pakistan's first online dating show, has sparked a culture clash, pitting a modern, digital generation against old-school morality.

Body returned by Hamas does not match any of the hostages, claims IsraelOn Tuesday, four bodies were handed over to Israel after the Jewish nation threatened to reduce humanitarian aid into Gaza for what it called the militant group's violation of its agreement to transfer remains under the US-brokered ceasefire deal reached last week.

New Hyundai Venue spotted and it looks drastically differentThe next-generation Hyundai Venue has been revealed undisguised, showcasing a bold new design, upgraded tech-rich interior, and advanced features ahead of its highly anticipated India debut next month.

Video: Accused of being anti-Sanatana, Muslim woman cop shouts Jai Shri RamA disagreement between police officer Hina Khan and lawyer Anil Mishra in Gwalior over a religious event at a Hanuman temple led to slogans, accusations, and a street protest.

Women's World Cup: India fined for slow over-rate against AustraliaIndia have been fined five percent of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate during their ICC Women's World Cup group-stage match against Australia in Visakhapatnam on Sunday (October 12).

Defiant India keeps Russia its top oil source. But here's the real storyOverall, India has remained defiant in its energy choices, keeping Russia as its top oil supplier despite mounting US tariffs and diplomatic pressure. While state refiners have cut back, private giants like Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy have significantly increased Russian crude imports.

Breaking the beat: When dancers get the Bollywood act rightThey started with rhythm in their veins, not scripts in their hands. Today, they're proving that the dance floor can be a gateway to stardom. The story explores how stars like Raghav Juyal, Nora Fatehi, and others have emerged as global icons.

Live: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav files nomination from Raghopur amid seat-sharing dramaAs the deadline for nominations nears, the NDA's seat-sharing arithmetic appears increasingly strained, with public unity masking deep internal dissatisfaction. JDU releases the first candidate list today with 57 names. The BJP on Tuesday announced its first list of 71 candidates, including Deputy Chief Ministers Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Sinha. The 243-member Bihar Assembly polls are scheduled for November 6 and 11, with counting on November 14. Follow indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Annamalai praises Dhanush's Idli Kadai: Like Rishab, you excel as director, actorBJP's Annamalai sent a letter appreciating actor Dhanush's directorial 'Idli Kadai'.  He highlighted the film's portrayal of youth issues and village culture.

If they're inefficient, what can I do: Nara Lokesh's Karnataka jab over Google dealJDS slammed Karnataka's Congress government, blaming inefficiency for Google choosing Andhra Pradesh. Nara Lokesh defended Andhra, highlighting infrastructure and leadership. Priyank Kharge questioned the huge incentives offered to attract the investment.

Xiaomi electric car bursts into flames in China, driver burnt alive insideA Xiaomi electric car caught fire after a sudden power failure, trapping the driver inside and burning him alive. The incident has raised urgent questions about electric vehicle safety and emergency escape features.

Green crackers allowed on Diwali in Delhi, Supreme Court sets time limitsThe Supreme Court ordered that bursting of firecrackers will be allowed only between 6 am and 7 am, and then from 8 pm to 10 pm. It also said the sale and bursting of the green crackers will be permitted in designated locations.

Wife shouldn't spin husband around: Top court to couple in marital dispute caseA bench of Justices BV Nagarathna and R Mahadevan advised the couple to prioritise the child's welfare and attempt to resolve their differences through mediation.

No, this Bihar man did not host his own funeral to test people's 'affection'Confusion spread online after reports stated that Mohan Lal, a 74-year-old retired Air Force officer from Bihar, conducted his own funeral to see how many people would attend. However, the truth is both practical and deeply rooted in community service.

Laurence Fishburne wants to play Professor X in Marvel's new X-Men instalmentActor Laurence Fishburne has expressed his interest in portraying Professor Charles Xavier in the next 'X-Men' film. His proposal comes amid speculations about the future of the Marvel Cinematic Universe superhero franchise.

Annamalai praises Dhanush's Idli Kadai: Like Rishab, you excel as director, actorBJP's Annamalai sent a letter appreciating actor Dhanush's directorial 'Idli Kadai'.  He highlighted the film's portrayal of youth issues and village culture.

sports.headline: Every wicket felt like a five-wicket haul on difficult Delhi pitch: Siraj Mohammed Siraj revealed that every wicket he took during the second Test against West Indies in Delhi felt like a five-wicket haul due to the challenges of the surface. Siraj was adjudged Impact Player of the Series after taking ten wickets across two matches.

Rashid Khan tops ICC ODI bowling rankings after Bangladesh whitewash Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan has reclaimed the No. 1 spot in the ICC Men's ODI Bowling Rankings after playing a pivotal role in his team's 3-0 series sweep over Bangladesh in Abu Dhabi.

No Virat Kohli in Pat Cummins combined India-Australia ODI XI. Here's why Australia captain Pat Cummins was asked to make an all-time combined India-Australia playing XI. Cummins kept Virat Kohli out of that list. Here's why.

Watch: Aussie stars mock India's no-handshake stance vs Pakistan in promo video India tour of Australia: A promotional video featuring Australian cricketers has been taken down following backlash over its content, which appeared to mock India's decision to avoid handshakes with Pakistani players during the Asia Cup and the Women's World Cup.

BCCI slips as scorers mix up Musheer Khan with brother Sarfaraz Ranji Trophy 2025-26: The BCCI reportedly mixed up Sarfaraz Khan and his brother Musheer's names on the opening day of Mumbai's away game against Jammu & Kashmir in Srinagar. The scorecard initially showed Sarfaraz as being dismissed for a duck after opening the batting, but it was actually his brother who fell early on Day 1 of the contest.

Might be the last chance for Australian public to see Rohit-Kohli: Pat Cummins Australia captain Pat Cummins has called the upcoming ODI series against India a special occasion, suggesting it might be the last opportunity for fans in Australia to witness Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in action.

Prithvi Shaw out for duck as Maharashtra suffer horror start in Ranji Trophy Ranji Trophy: Maharashtra suffered a horror start on the opening day of the tournament. Four of their batters fell to ducks inside the first 4 overs of the match.

Ronaldo breaks record but Hungary deny Portugal early World Cup qualification Cristiano Ronaldo set a new record for World Cup qualifying goals, but Hungary secured a late 2-2 draw, preventing Portugal from clinching a spot in next summer's tournament with two games remaining.

Don't call it a home Test just because the venue is on Indian map: Ashwin Ravinchandran Ashwin has called for fixed Test centres in India. Ashwin on his YouTube channel said that it made no sense to not have home advantage despite playing in India.

Australia heading into Ashes with their worst team since 2010: Stuart Broad Former England pacer Stuart Broad believes Australia are heading into this winter's Ashes with its 'worst' team since 2010. Broad was responding to former Australia opener David Warner's prediction that England would lose the series 4-0 down under.

Prithvi Shaw out for duck as Maharashtra suffer horror start in Ranji Trophy Ranji Trophy: Maharashtra suffered a horror start on the opening day of the tournament. Four of their batters fell to ducks inside the first 4 overs of the match.

Australia heading into Ashes with their worst team since 2010: Stuart Broad Former England pacer Stuart Broad believes Australia are heading into this winter's Ashes with its 'worst' team since 2010. Broad was responding to former Australia opener David Warner's prediction that England would lose the series 4-0 down under.

Messi becomes player with most assists in international footballLionel Messi broke Neymar's world record to become the player with the most assists in international football. Overall, Messi now has 397 assists across 1,129 matches.

India women's team visits Mahakaleshwar Temple after twin World Cup lossesThe Indian women's cricket team visited Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple to seek blessings after consecutive three-wicket losses in their home World Cup campaign. India will aim to keep their semifinal hopes alive when they face England in Indore on October 19.
Watch: Indian team leaves for Australia for white-ball seriesThe Indian cricket team left for Australia on October 15. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli accompanied the team at Delhi's IGI airport.

Five key takeaways after India's 2-0 series win over the West IndiesIndia completed a 2-0 series sweep against West Indies showcasing emerging young players. The series highlighted key transition points and challenges in team strategy and player management.

Inspired by Shane Warne's wizardry, Kuldeep Yadav proves his worth in whitesKuldeep Yadav is finally receiving the consistent run in the Indian Test team that he has long deserved, after years of sporadic appearances. Through patience and relentless work on his craft—drawing inspiration from Shane Warne—he is poised to carry forward India's rich spin legacy following R. Ashwin's retirement.

Brilliant Bilal Sami helps Afghanistan thump Bangladesh by 200 runsBilal Sami starred with the ball to help Afghanistan complete their decimation of Bangladesh with a commanding 200-run victory in the third and final ODI in Abu Dhabi, sealing a 3–0 series sweep.

Have Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli been put on notice?After India's win against West Indies, the focus has shifted straightaway to Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return. Ahead of the ODI series against Australia, head coach Gautam Gambhir might have just sent a subtle warning to the veteran duo.

Indian players scared of BCCI selectors? Rahane drops bombshell remarkIndian batter and former interim captain Ajinkya Rahane has called for radical changes to how selectors in the country's domestic cricket are appointed, saying that only recently retired first-class cricketers should be entrusted with the responsibility of picking teams.

Through patience and relentless work on his craft—drawing inspiration from Shane Warne—he is poised to carry forward India's rich spin legacy following R. Ashwin's retirement.

Indian players scared of BCCI selectors? Rahane drops bombshell remarkIndian batter and former interim captain Ajinkya Rahane has called for radical changes to how selectors in the country's domestic cricket are appointed, saying that only recently retired first-class cricketers should be entrusted with the responsibility of picking teams.

Team fell apart mentally: Carlo Ancelotti after Brazil's shocking defeat to JapanBrazil suffered a stunning 3–2 defeat to Japan, their first-ever loss to the Asian team. The defeat exposed mental weaknesses that Ancelotti says will be lessons for the World Cup preparation.

Muthuswamy, Harmer dismantle Pakistan as South Africa eye 1–0 leadSouth African spinners Senuran Muthusamy and Simon Harmer dismantled Pakistan's lineup, sharing nine wickets as the home side managed only 167 in their second innings. South Africa, chasing a venue-record 277, reached 51/2 by stumps, with Noman Ali's late double strike keeping pressure high heading into Day 4.

Women's World Cup: Colombo rain keeps SL winless, adds to New Zealand's woesSri Lanka women vs New Zealand women: Rain forced the abandonment of the Sri Lanka vs New Zealand Women's World Cup 2025 match in Colombo. Sri Lanka posted a good total of 258/6 in the first innings before rain washed out the entire second innings.

10-year-old Atiqa Mir bosses male pack for memorable win in RMC UAE ChampionshipTen-year-old Atiqa Mir made history by becoming the first female winner in the Minimax category at the RMC UAE Championship. Her victory highlights rising talent from India and marks a significant milestone in a male-dominated sport.

India's AFC Asian Cup 2027 qualification hopes shut down with 1-2 defeat to SingaporeIndia's hopes of qualifying for the 2027 AFC Asian Cup ended with a 2-1 loss to Singapore. The defeat highlights missed chances and defensive lapses that cost India dearly in the qualifiers.

India rally from two goals down to draw 3–3 with Pakistan in Sultan of Johor CupThe Indian junior men's hockey team fought back from two goals down to draw 3–3 with Pakistan in a thrilling Sultan of Johor Cup match. The result highlights India's resilience but leaves the group stage wide open ahead of final fixtures.

Rajiv Shukla denies rumours of Rohit, Kohli's retirement during Australia tourBCCI Vice President Rajiv Shukla has denied rumours of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's retirements after the upcoming tour of Australia, beginning on October 19 with a three-match ODI series.

Watch: Rohit Sharma lands in Delhi, set to depart with Team India for AustraliaStar India batter Rohit Sharma has landed in Delhi ahead of the three-match Test series against Australia set to begin on October 19. Rohit will link up with the rest of his teammates, who were already in the city for the second Test against West Indies. Team India will leave for Australia from Delhi in the wee hours of October 15.
The upcoming Australia series will mark the return of both Rohit and Virat Kohli to international cricket after the duo announced its Test retirement in May early this year It will also be the first series for Rohit after stepping down from captaincy and handing over the reins to Shubman Gill.
The star opener will be eager to return with a bang as he's set to play as a player for the first time since 2021.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
